result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel G Anderson Sr.

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Daniel G Anderson Sr. in court.  Attorney Maxwell Evan Carter in court for Daniel G Anderson Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status.
Defense is waiting on discovery and an offer.
State sends the offer via email.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 036113,
Payable Number: 475184,
Receipt Number: 22R 039457,
Amount: $20.00

11:10 AM Defendant Daniel G Anderson Sr. in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. Defendant requests time to retain an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

9:26 AM Defendant Daniel G Anderson Sr. in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 07/25/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
